title: Understanding Chemical Analysis
text: Chemical analysis can be broadly categorized into two types: qualitative and quantitative. Qualitative analysis identifies the components of a compound, while quantitative analysis determines the amount of each component.

title: Characterization in Analytical Chemistry
text: Characterization involves studying the chemical properties and structure of a compound. It often uses techniques like spectroscopy, chromatography, and mass spectrometry.

title: Choosing the Right Analysis
text: Given that the scientist is interested in the chemical properties of the compound, which type of analysis would be most appropriate?
